content.title: Egg Stuffed Paratha - Home made, Recipe
content.author: Karthik
content.content:
Egg Stuffed Paratha is a delicious and healthy Paratha dish, filled with egg mixture. Both the eggs and whole wheat are healthy as it provides the right amount of proteins and carbs. The egg mixture has finely chopped onions, green chili and coriander leaves. This is then slided into the half cooked paratha pockets and cooked further. The Egg Stuffed Parathas are quite filling in itself

Prerequisite

  • Prep time: 30 minutes
  • Cook time: 15 minutes
  • Number of servings: 4 persons

Ingredients

1. For the dough

  • Wheat flour 1 cup
  • Water
  • Oil
  • Salt to taste

2. For the egg stuffing

  • 2 Eggs
  • Onions 1
  • Green chili 2
  • Coriander leaves
  • Chili powder
  • Cumin powder
  • Garam masala
  • Chaat masala
  • Salt to taste

Method

  • In a bowl, add wheat flour, salt, oil and mix
  • Gradually add water and knead the dough
  • Divide the dough into equal portions
  • Place one of the portions onto a rolling surface and flatten it
  • Roll out the dough flat
  • Meanwhile, crack open the eggs into a glass/bowl, add all the ingredients for the stuffing
  • Mix everything well
  • Heat a tawa, place the rolled out chapati onto the tawa
  • Flip the chapati and cook on both sides for a couple of minutes
  • Make a slit on the chapati, create a pocket
  • Pour the egg mixture into the slit and seal it
  • Let the chapati cook and egg set inside
  • Apply ghee and cook on both sides till it is completely cooked
  • Cut the parathas and serve hot
